p: The results of the present research showed that the essential oil obtained from C. zeylanicum is rich in bioactive compounds, and its main chemical constituent is ( E)-cinnamaldehyde, comprising 71.5% of the total oil composition. The essential oil conferred superb antioxidant activity and antibacterial effect, especially towards Gram-positive bacteria. A dose-dependent antiproliferative activity was also observed when AT-MSCs were exposed to the essential oil at dosages from 1 to 200 mg·mL −1 for 24 h. Results have shown to be very positive and indicated good potential of the oil for use in food products as a natural bioactive ingredient. However, further studies are required to unravel the mechanisms underlying the antiproliferative activity of the essential oil of C. zeylanicum and to scale up its application in many food products.
